result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
State moves to dismiss and read in.  Defendant plead to charges in 15 CF 222 and 15 CF 291.  Motion granted.
Minutes.

Defense counsel was just recently assigned to these cases, he has not reviewed all materials.   Plea date reset to 12-11-15 at 2:30 p.m.   
Minutes.
Motion and Order allowing Matthew J. Kollell to withdraw as counsel of record.
records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt:
Settlement Conference Summary.
Plea hearing is set for 11-10-15 at 10:30 a.m.
State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.

Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 3 for trial.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed. Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty pleas entered.  Jury calendar.
Settlement conference with District Attorney is set for 06-17-15 at 3:30 p.m.
Plea date is set for 11-10-15 at 8:30 a.m.
Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.
Minutes.

Defendant in custody.   
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.   Preliminary hearing is set for 06-10-15 at 1:30 p.m.    
Minutes.

Defendant in custody on arrest warrant.  The matter is continued for an initial appearance on 06-01-15 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $5,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and drugs and have no contact with Rachelle Lyles.   Bail furnished and the defendant is released from custody.
Arrest warrant with service of officer thereon.
Minutes.
